message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a cross-modal matching problem between textual descriptions and visual contents, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL). The proposed model involves attention mechanisms and similarity-based hard attention, which are also common techniques in these two fields. The paper also mentions the use of a dataset for text-based person search, which falls under information retrieval (cs.IR) and multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper reports experimental results and compares its approach with state-of-the-art methods, which is a common practice in machine learning (cs.LG).
